author: Pedro Ramos
title: Identificada nova subvariante de Covid-19 em Pernambuco: Pirola (JN.1)
text: Uma nova subvariante do vÃ­rus da Covid-19, denominada Pirola (JN.1), foi identificada pelo Instituto Aggeu MagalhÃ£es, da FundaÃ§Ã£o Oswaldo Cruz (Fiocruz), em Pernambuco. O registro, feito na quarta-feira (27), marca o primeiro caso da linhagem no estado, alertando para uma possÃ­vel influÃªncia no aumento dos casos da doenÃ§a. Detalhes genÃ´micos e primeiro caso confirmado A Pirola, apontada como responsÃ¡vel pelo crescimento de casos em outros estados, como: CearÃ¡, Mato Grosso do Sul e EspÃ­rito Santo, agora se estabelece em Pernambuco. A pesquisa genÃ´mica realizada pelo Instituto abrangeu diversas cidades, revelando uma taxa de positividade preocupante de 26,9% entre 17 e 23 de dezembro. O sequenciamento genÃ©tico realizado nas cidades de Recife, JaboatÃ£o dos Guararapes, Olinda, Paulista, Ouricuri e Salgueiro resultou na identificaÃ§Ã£o de 30 genomas da Ã”micron. Entre eles, um genoma da subvariante Pirola foi detectado em uma paciente de 49 anos, residente no Recife, coletada em 12 de dezembro. AvaliaÃ§Ã£o de risco pela OMS e aÃ§Ãµes da SES Conforme relatado pela SES, os nÃºmeros de casos de Covid-19 em Pernambuco cresceram em quase 800% em novembro (Foto: reproduÃ§Ã£o/Freepik) A OrganizaÃ§Ã£o Mundial de SaÃºde (OMS) classifica a subvariante Pirola como "variante de interesse" devido Ã  sua transmissÃ£o acentuada, embora nÃ£o represente grande risco Ã  saÃºde pÃºblica, de acordo com a Secretaria Estadual de SaÃºde (SES). A SES destaca que continuarÃ¡ monitorando o cenÃ¡rio epidemiolÃ³gico e a circulaÃ§Ã£o de variantes em parceria com o Instituto Aggeu MagalhÃ£es. O nÃºmero de casos de Covid-19 em Pernambuco cresceu em quase 800% em novembro, conforme relata a SES. Mesmo com o aumento, 97% das notificaÃ§Ãµes sÃ£o de casos leves, que nÃ£o requerem internaÃ§Ã£o. Em resposta ao aumento, o governo autorizou a aplicaÃ§Ã£o de uma segunda dose da vacina bivalente para proteger contra a Ã”micron e suas subvariantes. Pesquisador da Fiocruz alerta para a situaÃ§Ã£o Marcelo Paiva, pesquisador da Fiocruz, ressalta que a identificaÃ§Ã£o da Pirola em Pernambuco Ã© mais uma evidÃªncia do aumento de casos no estado. Ele destaca que a linhagem foi detectada a partir de amostras coletadas em dezembro, evidenciando a dinÃ¢mica de circulaÃ§Ã£o do vÃ­rus. A Pirola, detectada pela primeira vez em julho de 2023 na Dinamarca, possui mais de 35 mutaÃ§Ãµes em partes cruciais do vÃ­rus, se comparada com a variante XBB.1.5. Essa Ãºltima, identificada no Brasil no inÃ­cio deste ano, foi responsÃ¡vel por um significativo aumento de casos em alguns paÃ­ses. Foto destaque: Conhecida como Pirola, subvariante da linhagem Ã”micron(ReproduÃ§Ã£o/Freepik)

author: Y. G.
title: Los trabajadores del comercio sopesan convocar una huelga en vÃ­speras de Navidad
text:
Los trabajadores del comercio sopesan convocar una huelga en vÃ­speras de Navidad
El sector, con mÃ¡s de 11.000 trabajadores en Asturias, reclama mejoras en el convenio
Y. G.
Los sindicatos UGT, CC OO, USO y FETICO anunciaron ayer que no descartan la posibilidad de convocar una huelga en el sector del comercio minorista en vÃ­speras de Navidad. Esta es una de las opciones que estudiarÃ¡ la asamblea convocada para maÃ±ana, la cual decidirÃ¡ sobre la negociaciÃ³n del convenio colectivo de minoristas de alimentaciÃ³n en Asturias, que afecta a mÃ¡s de 11.000 trabajadores. El convenio recoge las condiciones de supermercados y tiendas pequeÃ±as, pero no de grandes superficies.
Los sindicatos afirmaron que las negociaciones estÃ¡n paralizadas por el "abismo" existente entre las condiciones que propone la patronal y las reivindicaciones de los trabajadores. Por ejemplo, en materia salarial, estos piden un incremento del 4% para este aÃ±o, frente a la propuesta de la patronal del 2,8% para 2024 el y 2,5% en 2025.
En la asamblea, que tendrÃ¡ lugar en
Lugones, los trabajadores determinarÃ¡n las acciones a tomar ante un convenio que en cuatro de sus niveles profesionales coincide con el salario mÃ­nimo interprofesional y "casi no hay diferencia" entre categorÃ­as con diferencias responsabilidades, reprochan los sindicatos, que tambiÃ©n lamentan que "no se hayan producido avances" tras varias reuniones en los Ãºltimos meses.
SuscrÃ­bete para seguir leyendo

author: Da AE
title: Katy Perry viajarÃ¡ ao espaÃ§o em foguete com tripulaÃ§Ã£o feminina
text:
Katy Perry irÃ¡ viajar ao espaÃ§o em uma missÃ£o da Blue Origin, empresa de foguetes de Jeff Bezos, dono da Amazon.
O anÃºncio foi feito pela empresa nesta quinta-feira, 27. A data de lanÃ§amento nÃ£o foi revelada.
A missÃ£o Ã© chamada de NS-31, jÃ¡ que serÃ¡ o 31Â° lanÃ§amento do foguete New Shepard, alÃ©m de ser 11Â° com passageiros.
Lauren SÃ¡nchez, namorada de Bezos, irÃ¡ acompanhar a cantora. A tripulaÃ§Ã£o da viagem serÃ¡ exclusivamente feminina. AlÃ©m das duas, a cientista da Nasa Aisha Bowe, a pesquisadora em bioastronÃ¡utica Amanda Ngueyn, a jornalista Gayle King e a produtora cinematogrÃ¡fica Kerianne Flynn tambÃ©m serÃ£o passageiras do voo.
Elas participarÃ£o de um voo suborbital, ou seja, a nave nÃ£o irÃ¡ superar a atmosfera terrestre.
AtenÃ§Ã£o! Os comentÃ¡rios do site sÃ£o via Facebook. Lembre-se de que o comentÃ¡rio Ã© de inteira responsabilidade do autor e nÃ£o expressa a opiniÃ£o do jornal. ComentÃ¡rios que violem a lei, a moral e os bons costumes ou violem direitos de terceiros poderÃ£o ser denunciados pelos usuÃ¡rios e sua conta poderÃ¡ ser banida.

author: Awin P
title: Happy and humbled: Vyjayanthimala Bali on being conferred Padma Vibhushan
text: A fter receiving the Padma Vibhushan award, veteran actor Vyjayanthimala Bali expressed her happiness. Vyjayanthimala received the award in the field of Art from President Droupadi Murmu in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah. The ceremony took place at Rashtrapati Bhavan in the national capital. After attending the ceremony, Vyjayantimala spoke with ANI and expressed her happiness. She said, "I have to thank my god for his compassion, kindness, and mercy... It's our Prime Minister Narendra Modi Ji and the Government of India who have recognised my art- dance as well as films. I received the Padma Shri in 1969, and now Padma Vibhushan is a very big thing. I am happy and humbled to receive this award." Recently, the legendary actress met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Chennai. Taking to X, PM Modi shared pictures from her meeting with Vyjayanthimala. In one of the images, PM Modi can be seen greeting Vyjayanthimala with folded hands. "Glad to have met Vyjayanthimala Ji in Chennai. She has just been conferred the Padma Vibhushan and is admired across India for her exemplary contribution to the world of Indian cinema," he wrote. Vyjayanthimala made her screen debut at the age of 16 with the Tamil film Vaazhkai (1949). 'Devdas', 'Sangam', 'Madhumanti' and 'Naya Daur' are some of her iconic films. Padma Awards, one of the highest civilian Awards of the country, are conferred in three categories, namely, Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan and Padma Shri. The Awards are given in various disciplines and fields of activities like art, social work, public affairs, science and engineering, trade and industry, medicine, literature and education, sports, civil service, etc. 'Padma Vibhushan' is awarded for exceptional and distinguished service, 'Padma Bhushan' for distinguished service of high order and 'Padma Shri' for distinguished service in any field. The awards are announced on the occasion of Republic Day every year. âœ”ï¸ ðŸ’• Found this article helpful? Spread the word and support us!

author: Travis Schlepp
title: Popular social media chef says he's cancer-free after given 30% chance to live - NewsBreak
text: ( KTLA ) â€“ Kevin Ashton, a sorority chef and content creator with millions of followers on social media, says heâ€™s â€œessentially cancer-freeâ€ after originally being given a 30% chance of survival. In September 2023, Ashton, a chef at the University of Nevada Pi Beta Phi sorority house, was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic melanoma. â€œMy prognosis wasnâ€™t that good,â€ he said in a post over the weekend. â€œAnd trust me, that kind of news changes your life.â€ Often referred to by his followers as the Bob Ross of cooking thanks to his calm demeanor, soft voice and easy-to-follow instructional videos, Ashton has amassed more than 5 million followers on TikTok and Instagram, and has continued to post his cooking videos and talk candidly about his diagnosis and treatment. â€œItâ€™s been an incredible journey,â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s had plenty of ups and downs.â€ Last summer, Ashton said a mutation in his cancer caused a new tumor to start growing. That tumor was eventually eradicated with radiation, and after more than 20 infusions of immunotherapy, he received a positive update during his most recent body scan. â€œI got the results on Friday, and guys, it shows zero metabolic activity in my body,â€ Ashton said in his latest cooking video. â€œIâ€™m essentially cancer-free.â€ Throughout his journey, Ashton, whose social handle is @oldscoolkevmo, continued to espouse the importance of positivity, always signing off his videos with a â€œcheersâ€ and his catchphrase, â€œwhat a treat.â€ He credited that same positive outlook as the difference maker in his treatment. â€œI did everything wrong in terms of treating your own cancer. I didnâ€™t eat well, I didnâ€™t exercise. The one thing I did and I stayed true to the whole time was being positive,â€ he said. â€œAnd folks, the power of positivity does wonders. It changed my life and it changed the course of my cancer.â€ While making 20 servings of overnight oats in his sorority house kitchen, Ashton thanked his followers for joining him on his cancer journey and encouraged them to â€œkeep on smiling and keep on trucking.â€ And, of course, he signed off with his trademark slogan â€œwhat a treatâ€ â€” and this time, it really was. For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to NewsNation.

author: Erik S. Hanley
title: K9 Bane of St. Francis honored with national award for service
text:
The famous retired St. Francis K9 Bane has been recognized for his accomplishments with a Distinguished Service Medal.
The medal, awarded by the Animals in War & Peace organization, honors animals for their service both in civilian and military duty.
â€œThey give two medals every year and itâ€™s any animal that has served in the public safety sector or military,â€ said St. Francis Police Detective Holly McManus, Baneâ€™s owner and former handler. â€œPigeons have won it and horses and dogs, both military and law enforcement.â€
Animals in War & Peace Distinguished Service Medal will be awarded to three canines by members of Congress at a special ceremony in Washington, D.C. on March 6. Additionally, Congress will also present the organization's medal of bravery to four canines at the event.
McManus is glad those officers and soldiers with paws, hooves and wings are now getting recognition through an organization like Animals in War & Peace.
â€œI wish that there was more recognition for those types of heroes so Iâ€™m glad weâ€™re starting to see more recognition for the officers, the handlers, who work with these dogs and these dogs who do great things,â€ she said, adding itâ€™s OK to put your accomplishments out there and be proud of them, and those of your peers.
Bane gets a special local ceremony While the official award presentation wonâ€™t take place until March, Bane, a German shepherd, was honored locally with a ceremony Dec. 13 and given a temporary medal as his official one is still being created.
The main reason Bane got special early recognition is that he is battling degenerative myelopathy, a disorder similar to ALS in humans, and itâ€™s sadly possible he either wonâ€™t be around or able to travel in March.
â€œI was humbled by (their offer of an early ceremony) because not only are they giving Bane that award, but they are making the effort to make sure heâ€™s around to be appreciated for it,â€ McManus said.
McManus might not make it to the ceremony herself if Bane is still alive and canâ€™t travel, â€œbecause there really wonâ€™t be anyone to take care of him,â€ she said.
On Baneâ€™s official Facebook page, which ha s over 11,000 followers , McManus posts regular updates to Baneâ€™s condition and his day-to-day goings on. In a post on Dec. 28, she outlined how she spends about two hours a day doing special tasks taking care of Bane including cleaning, grooming, and simply moving/carrying him as he canâ€™t control the lower half of his body.
But, she said Bane keeps surprising her, so McManus said she hasnâ€™t ruled out the trip, saying she was told the hotel would be accommodating to them.
Baneâ€™s nomination and award criteria The Milwaukee FBI division nominated Bane for the award. McManus and her canine companion served with the FBIâ€™s SWAT team for three years, taking on everything from violent crime to domestic terror in the greater Milwaukee area, Waukesha County, Brown County and into northern Illinois.
â€œWe did over 36 missions with the FBI in those three years and Bane was on every single one of those and was used in most of them as the first soul in the building,â€ McManus said. â€œWe played an active role with that team, and I think thatâ€™s how this got going.â€
Additionally, St. Francis Police Chief Kevin Hunter and state Rep. Christine Sinicki also submitted letters of nomination for Bane. In 2021, Sinicki awarded McManus and Bane with the First Responder of the Year Award .
In his nomination letter, St. Francis Mayor Ken Tutaj said Bane was directly responsible for leading to the arrest of over 200 offenders.
"He was the first officer through the door on multiple building searches, placing his life in front of his fellow officers," Tutaj said. "As the Cityâ€™s very first K9 officer he has been, and continues to be, an inspiration to both local citizens and people throughout the country and around the world through social media.â€
Criteria for the distinguished service medal, according to the Animals in War & Peace website , include â€œexceptional performance of duty, clearly above that normally expected, which has contributed materially to the success of a unit, command or departmentâ€ or â€œsustained superior performance throughout the course of their duties.â€
More: St. Francis' K9 Bane is getting his own foundation to help other service dogs and handlers
Finding out Bane was selected It was around Thanksgiving when a call came in on a Sunday night from an unknown number. McManus answered and it was Robin Hutton, founder of Animals in War & Peace informing her Bane was chosen to receive the distinguished service award.
â€œI keep saying that this is the proudest moment of my career; the final chapter of our journey,â€ McManus said. â€œThe connection that an animal, a service animal especially, can make with the human soul is incredible and I think that Baneâ€™s story is not just about a dog with a terminal illness, people are actually connecting with his struggles and his strength and his bravery and his journey and I think thatâ€™s all a part of this.
"Every time he accomplishes something even in retirement, it just reminds me how lucky and how blessed I am to have taken this journey with him.â€
While Bane has slowed down physically, mentally heâ€™s still the same dog who can sometimes be a little grumbly.
â€œHeâ€™s still the Bane I got a decade ago, and thatâ€™s how I know he still wants to be on this side of the bridge with us,â€ McManus said. â€œHe still has his personality.â€
McManus thought Bane may pass on after his bronze statue was revealed in front of the St. Francis Civic Center because heâ€™d feel her relief as that chapter closed. But Bane has continued to push on and McManus said she plans to keep going with him until he tells her heâ€™s ready to leave.
â€œI feel like heâ€™s saying, â€˜Iâ€™m not done yet, letâ€™s see what else we can do,â€™â€ she said.
Contact Erik S. Hanley at erik.hanley@jrn.com . Like his Facebook page, The Redheadliner , and follow him on X @Redheadliner .

author: API User
title: Explore the Magical World of Fungi at Corinna Wilderness Village, Tasmania
text:
Corinna, Tasmania â€“ March 2025 â€“ Corinna Wilderness Lodge, located in the pristine Tarkine rainforest, is offering two exclusive "Fungus Lovers" packages this June for nature enthusiasts and photography lovers. Set against the stunning backdrop of Tasmaniaâ€™s untouched wilderness, guests can embark on a fascinating journey into the world of fungi, guided by expert mycologist Alison Pouliot and renowned photographer Luke Oâ€™Brien.
These eco-friendly retreats allow visitors to discover the region's rich fungal diversity, featuring species that can only be found in this remote corner of the world. The packages, designed to cater to both budding and experienced nature lovers, include guided fungi walks, photography workshops, and an immersive experience in the heart of the Tarkine rainforest.
Fungus Photography with Luke Oâ€™Brien â€“ June 2025
From May 31 to June 3, 2025, the â€œFungus Photographyâ€ package offers a three-night stay at Corinna Wilderness Village, where participants will join talented Tasmanian photographer Luke Oâ€™Brien. Renowned for his captivating images of Tasmaniaâ€™s fungi, Oâ€™Brien will teach guests how to capture the essence of these mysterious organisms. Over the course of three days, attendees will learn practical tips on camera settings, composition, and focus techniques while exploring the many trails surrounding Corinna during the peak of fungi season. There will also be an opportunity to edit and refine photographs in a group post-processing session.
Discover Fungi with Alison Pouliot â€“ June 2025
From June 3 to June 6, 2025, the â€œDiscover Fungi with an Expert Mycologistâ€ package invites guests to explore the wonders of the fungal kingdom with renowned mycologist Alison Pouliot. Pouliot, an expert in the ecology and cultural significance of fungi, will guide participants on interactive walks through the Tarkine Rainforest, offering insights into the crucial ecological role fungi play in this vibrant ecosystem. Attendees will uncover the fascinating biology, cultural connections, and environmental importance of fungi in hands-on seminars and rainforest forays.
Package Details & Pricing
Accommodation for both events is in Corinnaâ€™s cozy, eco-friendly cabins. The Fungi Lovers 3-Night Stay package prices are as follows:
- Queen Cottage (1 Person): $1149
- Queen Cottage (2 Persons): $1371
- Family Cottage (2 Persons): $1554
- Family Cottage (3 Persons): $1776
- Family Cottage (4 Persons): $1998
Note: Additional costs may apply for optional activities like kayaking or scenic cruises during your stay.
Booking and Enquiries
Spaces are limited for these exclusive packages, so early booking is recommended. For more information or to book, please contact reservations@corinna.com.au or visit www.corinna.com.au.
About Corinna Wilderness Lodge
Corinna Wilderness Lodge is an eco-conscious retreat located in the heart of Tasmaniaâ€™s Tarkine rainforest. With its commitment to sustainability and environmental preservation, Corinna offers a unique blend of adventure, education, and relaxation in one of Australiaâ€™s most biodiverse regions. Guests can enjoy a range of activities from guided hikes to kayaking and cruises, all within a pristine wilderness setting.
For press inquiries, please contact:
Reservations: reservations@corinna.com.au
Website: www.corinna.com.au
This exciting opportunity promises to be a once-in-a-lifetime experience for all those passionate about fungi and the natural world.
